choices.A: Increase the time-to-live on service tokens
choices.D: Reduce the number of policies attached to the tokens

questions.question_text: You are performing a high number of authentications in a short amount of time. You're experiencing slow throughput for token generation. How would you solve this problem?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct:

# vault token lookup -accessor $accessor | grep policies
policies [default ssh-sign]

Selected Answer: C
Policies control the Token's access to different paths.

questions.question_text: When looking at Vault token details, which key helps you find the paths the token is able to access?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A contains the correct syntax and Lease ID.

questions.question_text: When an auth method is disabled, all users authenticated via that method lose access.
An authentication method should be selected for a use case based on:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This seems the most logical of the choices.

choices.A: The auth method that best establishes the identity of the client
choices.D: Compatibility with the secret engine which is to be used
choices.C: The strongest available cryptographic hash for the use case
choices.B: The cloud provider for which the client is located on
